intro: Jussiaea leptocarpa var. meyeriana, commonly known as the Meyer's narrow-leaf jussiaea, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, acidic soils. It is often found in association with other aquatic or semi-aquatic flora, contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some regions for garden use.
